title: Who is Elsie Hewitt? All About Pete Davidson's Girlfriend
summary: Pete Davidson is expecting his first child with girlfriend Elsie Hewitt. Here's what to know about her.
story: Pete Davidson has always dreamed of being a dad — and now he will be, thanks to his pregnant girlfriend, Elsie Hewitt.
Hewitt announced on July 16 that the couple was expecting their first child when she posted a carousel of pics on Instagram that included a sonogram image of their baby on the way.
"Welp now everyone knows we had sex,” Hewitt joked in her caption.
Davidson and Hewitt have been romantically linked since March 2025. They made their red carpet debut as a couple two months later at a charity event.
Read on to learn all about Hewitt.
Hewitt is a Model and Actor
Hewitt got her big break modeling. She appeared as a June 2017 Playmate in Playboy magazine and has worked with well-known fashion brands, including Guess.
Hewitt later began focusing on acting. She's appeared on several TV shows, including "Turnt," "Dave" and "Industry."
She also had parts in the movie "Teenage Badass" and in Benny Blanco's star-studded music video "Benny Blanco & Juice WRLD: Graduation."
She and Pete Davidson Have Been Linked Since March 2025
Hewitt and Davidson were first romantically linked in March 2025 when they were spotted kissing while swimming together in Palm Beach, Florida, People reported at the time.
She Made Her Red Carpet Debut With Davidson in May 2025

The pair made their official red carpet debut as a couple on May 15 when they stepped out together to the 13th Annual Blossom Ball, which raises money for endometriosis research and education, at the Pierre Hotel in New York City.
Hewitt wore a body-hugging glittery gold gown while Davidson wore loose-fitting tan dress pants and a cream-colored dress shirt.
The pair smiled for photographers as the posed with their arms around each other.
She Shares Affectionate Photos of Davidson
Hewitt isn't shy about sharing glimpses of her life with Davidson, which includes frequent outings in nature.

A week before announcing the couple was expecting, Hewitt posted a carousel of pics on Instagram that included images of her and the former "Saturday Night Live" star kissing in a small boat and another of Davidson rowing a canoe across a lake.
"some happi & grateful moments that got me thru a weird chaotic month," she captioned her post.
In March, she shared pics and videos of her and Davidson on a day trip to the countryside where they fed carrots to horses.
She's Had Famous Boyfriends in the Past
Hewitt has been linked to several famous men in the past, including another former "SNL" star, Jason Sudeikis, and has also dated Benny Blanco and Ryan Phillippe, according to People.
In 2017, she filed a civil lawsuit against Phillippe accusing him of an alleged assault, which Phillippe publicly denied. The two reached a settlement in 2019, People reported.

title: EXCLUSIVE: Taye Diggs Reveals His Secret To Peaceful, Happy Co-Parenting With Ex Idina Menzel
summary: Taye Diggs is giving his ex-wife, Idina Menzel, ample credit when it comes to their publicly admired co-parenting of 15-year-old son Walker Diggs.
story: Taye Diggs is giving his ex-wife, Idina Menzel, ample credit when it comes to their publicly admired co-parenting of 15-year-old son Walker Diggs.
“She is — she’s driving. She’s the driver of the bus. So I respect that,” he says of Menzel. “And it’s worked out pretty OK so far. So, if it ain’t broke, I’m not trying to fix a beautiful thing.”
When asked how the two former “Rent” co-stars maintain their family dynamic after deciding to separate in 2013, Diggs breaks out a big smile, telling TODAY.com backstage at 30 Rock, “It’s Walker.”

“We both love Walker so much that it only works if we think about him first, and when we put him first,” Diggs says, beaming. “We can’t help but kind of respect each other and what we’re all bringing.”
The actor, who is returning to the stage in “Moulin Rouge” on Broadway, is quick to credit Menzel for her impact.
The praise is mutual. In a January interview with TODAY.com, Menzel said she’s “proud” of how she and Diggs manage co-parenting following divorce.

“I have to say that I’m very proud of that,” she said at the time. “We really don’t believe in putting a child in the middle of anything and forcing them to have to choose in any way, and we never speak poorly of the other. I’m really proud of us for putting him first.”
Walker has been homeschooled this year so he can split time between his dad in California and his mom in New York. In the January interview, Menzel poked fun at her constant need to be near her son.
“I can’t be away from him for more than a couple weeks. I’m too controlling,” Menzel joked.

In 1996, Diggs and Menzel met when starring in the Broadway production of “Rent,” in which they originated the roles of Benjamin Coffin III and Maureen Johnson. They welcomed Walker in 2009 and subsequently separated after 10 years of marriage. Menzel has been married to actor-turned-therapist Aaron Lohr since 2017.
In the past year, Walker has begun stepping out to show support for each of his parent's impressive careers.

In November 2024, Walker made a red carpet appearance alongside his mom at the Los Angeles premiere of the movie “Wicked,” based on the Broadway show in which Menzel originated the role of Elphaba. A month later, Walker accompanied his dad at the Critics Choice’s Celebration Of Black Cinema in LA.
As for whether Walker has acquired his parents’ singing and acting chops, Diggs gushed about him to “Entertainment Tonight” in an April 2024 interview.
“He can act. He can sing. He can dance,” Diggs said at the time of Walker, adding that his son is also “a fierce athlete.”

title: Rob Kardashian Reveals Why He Stepped Away From TV in Rare Interview
summary: Rob Kardashian prefers a life outside of the spotlight. In an interview with Khloé Kardashian, he explained why he stepped away from reality TV.
story: Unlike his famous family, Rob Kardashian prefers a life outside of the spotlight.
While chatting with his sister Khloé Kardashian on the July 16 episode of her “Khloe in Wonder Land” podcast, he revealed why he took a step back from TV to live a private life.

"It just has everything to do with myself. I don't want to be filming and putting myself in a position where I'm not comfortable," he said. "I'm not comfortable in my skin so why would I want to go and be on camera and just be vulnerable and let people in when that’s not what I want to do?”

"I haven't been comfortable with myself in years and also filming and just doing all that, it's not for everybody. And I choose my own happiness and peace rather than filming for somebody who doesn't do anything for me and my personal life. That's the truth," he added.
While the two chatted on the phone, Khloé Kardashian then asked her brother if he would ever consider returning to reality   TV.

The sole Kardashian brother hasn’t made many appearances on his family’s Hulu show, “The Kardashians.” However, he did put his life on display in 2016 when he filmed “Rob & Chyna” with his ex-fiancée, Blac Chyna.
The two showed the ups and downs in their relationship and their life with their daughter, Dream, who is now 8 years old.

“I love filming if it’s positive and natural and I’m feeling good about myself, then of course if I’m comfortable,” he explained about returning to TV. “I like being around my family so that stuff is good to me.”
During their chat, Rob Kardashian also opened up about his dating life.

“I’m good at talking to people. But also there (are) moments where I’m like, OK, I can’t talk to anybody, it’s too much energy. It’s just too much. I’m talking to too many people. I don’t want to be like that,” he said.

title: What Happened to Amy Bradley? New Doc Focuses on 23-Year-Old Who Disappeared During Cruise
summary: Who is Amy Bradley? What happened to her? Where is she now? Was she kidnapped? The documentarians of Amy Bradley is Missing weigh in on the theories.
story: In March 1998, 23-year-old Amy Lynn Bradley boarded the Rhapsody of the Seas with her parents and younger brother for a Caribbean cruise. Just a day and a half into the trip, she vanished.
The ship was approaching Curaçao, and Amy Bradley had been out late with her brother at the ship’s nightclub, according to the FBI. By early morning, she was gone.

The case drew national attention at the time and has continued to surface in internet forums, true crime podcasts and TV specials in the decades since. But Amy Bradley’s disappearance has never been solved. No body was found. No charges were filed. And no official explanation has ever been confirmed.

Now, 26 years later, a new Netflix docuseries, “Amy Bradley Is Missing,” looks back at her disappearance. Directed by Ari Mark and Phil Lott, the three-part series revisits key witness accounts and theories — from possible overboard scenarios to organized trafficking — while focusing on the family’s decades-long search for answers.

“The story has so many layers,” Mark tells TODAY.com. “And when you sit with this family in their home and hear what they’ve been through, you understand why this is a story that deserves to be told.”
A long-unsolved case
Amy Bradley disappeared in the early morning hours of March 24, 1998, as the ship neared the island of Curaçao.
She was last seen asleep on her chair on the balcony of the ship’s eighth deck at 4:30 a.m, according to the Curacao police, as reported by the South Florida Sun-Sentinel in 1998.
At the time, Netherlands Antilles Coast Guard Lt. Sjoerd Soethout said, to reporters, she may have fallen from the balcony.
The FBI at the time searched the ship in St. Maarten, its next destination, and an FBI spokeswoman said the agency had “no evidence of foul play,” the AP reported at the time.
The FBI is still offering a $25,000 reward for information leading to Bradley’s recovery.
The family’s theories
In the years since, dozens of explanations have circulated — including a theory she was kidnapped and speculation that she fell or jumped overboard.
Her family has long believed she was taken against her will and may still be alive, which her parents, Ron and Iva Bradley, and brother Brad Bradley reiterate in the documentary.

The docuseries does not offer a definitive conclusion. Instead, it builds a detailed timeline and walks viewers through how the investigation unfolded and where it hit dead ends. Throughout, the series places the Bradleys at the center of the story, offering a portrait of a family still living with questions. The docuseries also features interviews with people who believe they saw Amy Bradley at various locations in the Caribbean.
“The thing that keeps them going, and kept us going, is that their hope is completely inextinguishable,” Mark says. “Amy is present for them every single second of every single day.”
“Every single day wasn’t just another day of production, every single day was another day that Amy could be home,” Lott adds.
Ron and Iva Bradley filed two lawsuits on the same day against Royal Caribbean Cruises Ltd. in Miami-Dade court. Both were dismissed in 1999.
Telling a story without a conclusion
With no definitive conclusion to Amy Bradley’s case, the filmmakers behind “Amy Bradley Is Missing” faced a challenge: how do you tell a complete story when the central mystery remains unsolved?

“We really tried not to present anything to viewers that we didn’t ourselves think was real or credible,” Mark says. “There’s a lot of fact checking, a lot of information gathering and research that goes into these things so if certain leads had no substance we didn’t put them in the show.”

That approach guided how they structured the series. The episodes aren’t just a string of rumors — they follow a clear timeline, anchored by evidence, official reports and direct interviews. Each theory introduced in the series, whether involving foul play, accidental death, or human trafficking, is rooted in credible information, but never framed as the definitive truth.

The result is a docuseries that resists sensationalism. Instead of promising answers, it leans into uncertainty, inviting viewers to sit with the discomfort that the Bradleys have lived with for more than two decades.

“You go into a project like this thinking maybe you’ll land somewhere. And instead, every time we thought we had a theory nailed down, something else would unravel it,” Lott says. “We’d find ourselves saying, ‘OK, it’s definitely this.’ And then by the next day, ‘Actually, no. It might be something else entirely.’”

While they won’t reveal which theory they personally believe, they agree that something shifted early that morning on the ship. “Something happened that cannot be explained at about 5:45 a.m. on that ship,” Lott says. “That started the timeline that is not easy to answer.”
Mark adds that the ambiguity has never meant indifference. “We know there’s more to it,” he says. “It’s not so cut and dry.”

By Episode 3, the show has made its position clear: the point isn’t to provide closure, because closure may never come. Instead, it’s about creating clarity around the facts, while honoring the ambiguity that still defines Amy Bradley’s case.
What Amy Bradley’s family is doing now

The final episode of “Amy Bradley Is Missing” doesn’t offer resolution. Instead, it offers an invitation — to re-engage with a case that, after 26 years, still holds unanswered questions for her family.
For the filmmakers, this isn’t just a story about one family’s grief. It’s also a story about how collective attention, even decades later, might still help uncover the truth.

“We’re always excited about getting shows out for the public,” Lott tells TODAY.com. “It’s a wonderful conclusion to a process, but when you meet this family and you hear how present and alive Amy is for them every single second of every single day, the responsibility for getting a show onto the air is about life and death.”

Amy’s family continues to hold out hope. In the closing moments of the series, her mother, Iva Bradley, says they wake up every day thinking “maybe today,” and go to bed each night thinking “maybe tomorrow.”
That hope, unshaken after more than two decades, is what the filmmakers say anchored the entire project.

Between moments of uncertainty and unresolved leads, the series returns again and again to the person at the center: a daughter, a sister, a friend. “This show, more than others, feels communal,” Mark says. “If we can engage enough people around the world—people who want to do something, people who want to help—we think there’s a real chance something new could come to light.”
For the Bradleys, that possibility is everything. Even now, they believe someone, somewhere, knows something. And they’re still waiting for the right person to speak up.

title: 5 Books to Read After 'Happy Wife,' According to Authors Meredith Lavender and Kendall Shores
summary: Here are 5 books to read after Happy Wife by Meredith Lavender and Kendall Shores
story: "Happy Wife," Read With Jenna's July 2025 pick, is all about appearances – and how, of course, they can be deceiving. This thriller is set in an affluent Florida town. One woman, an outsider who married an insider, grapples with her life turned upside down when her husband disappears.

The novel was written by Meredith Lavender and Kendall Shores, who met at school pickup at the kids' school. Lavender, a TV writer, and Shores, who works in communication, found a way to explore their interest in true crime and insular communities in the book.

“I think it was just lightning in a bottle, you know? It’s that moment in time where, like, right idea, right person and then right moment,” Lavender told TODAY.com. “So I think for us, it was a really fun process.”
Below, Lavender and Shores shared their recommendations for books to read after "Happy Wife," which — chances are — you raced through already.
"Problematic Summer Romance" by Ali Hazelwood
"Problematic Summer Romance" by Ali Hazelwood
Set in the Ionian coast, this sequel book follows the continuing relationship of Connor and Maya.

We love a romcom heroine. There’s something deeply human about their humor, their vulnerability and their courage. We always talk about Nora as a romcom heroine who comes to realize she’s in a mystery in Happy Wife. Ali Hazelwood always walks a careful line between smart, sexy and sincere. Maya leans on her chosen family and a broken heart to find her rightful place.
"Sunburned" by Katherine Wood
"Sunburned: A Novel" by Katherine Wood
This book has a summer murder mystery and romance!

Wood has a knack for transporting you to exotic locations, and then revealing the scandals of the people who inhabit them. Her latest mystery sends readers on a journey about the choices women make to survive, to reinvent themselves, and what that costs. Even when you’re on vacation. Come for the tropical setting, stay for the emotional wreckage.
"Seems Perfect" by Rebecca Hanover
"Seems Perfect: A Novel" by Rebecca Hanover
This mystery novel follows a woman who meets a nightmare roommate, but when a murder mystery occurs, both women have to set aside differences to find out what happened.

Hanover’s latest book has all the trappings of a page-turning mystery that will keep you guessing until the page. Like all of her books, no matter the genre, it’s clever and sarcastic with just the right edge of suspense. Hanover knows how to take a great story and make it just a little bit twisted. And in Seems Perfect, she reminds us how quickly things can change when you let the wrong person into your life.
"The Devil at his Elbow" by Valerie Bauerlein
"The Devil at His Elbow" by Valerie Bauerlein
Read about the real-life mystery behind the Murdaugh family murders.

If you weren’t expecting a sharp left turn into true crime, we get it. But the tragedies central to Devil at His Elbow—stores of crime and loss that gripped a small town in South Carlina—were the early spark of Happy Wife, spinning up questions of power, illusion and the way criminal investigations reveal the lore and legends of a small community.
"The Customs of the Country" by Edith Wharton
"The Custom of the Country" by Edith Wharton
Get a look into the exploitations and absurdities of the upper class in this novel.

Wharton is the godmother of social commentary as we know it. Sharp and subversive, she wrote women like Undine Spragg—ambitious, beautiful, and dangerously self-possessed—long before “unlikable” heroines became a trend. We love Wharton for her wit as much as for her deep awareness of the pressures facing women in her time.

title: Pete Davidson Is Expecting His 1st Child With Elsie Hewitt. See The Announcement
summary: Pete Davidson and his girlfriend, Elsie Hewitt, are expecting a baby together. She announced the pregnancy news on Instagram.
story: Pete Davidson is going to be a dad!
The former "Saturday Night Live" star, 31, and his model girlfriend, Elsie Hewitt, are expecting their first child.
The news was first reported July 16 by TMZ with Hewitt confirming the couple is expecting a short time later on Instagram.
Hewitt shared a carousel of photos, including a sonogram image of the couple's baby on the way as well as footage of Hewitt smiling as she underwent her ultrasound.
She also included photos of her and Davidon posing together in a grassy field.
"Welp now everyone knows we had sex," Hewitt joked in her caption.
Davidson and Hewitt have been romantically linked since March when they were photographed swimming together at a beach, according to People.
In May, the couple made their red carpet debut in May at the 13th Annual Blossom Ball, an event that raises money for endometriosis research and education, at the Pierre Hotel in New York City.

Davidson's famous exes include Ariana Grande and Kim Kardashian, while Hewitt has dated actors Jason Sudeikis and Ryan Phillippe. Hewitt filed a civil lawsuit again Phillippe in 2017 over an alleged assault, which Phillippe publicly denied. The two reached a settlement in 2019, reported People.
Davidson has previously opened up about wanting kids of his own.
“I'm definitely a family guy. My favorite thing ever, which I have yet to achieve, is I want to have a kid,” he told comedian Kevin Hart during an episode of Hart's chat show "Hart to Heart."
“That’s like my dream," Davidson added. "That’s kind of what I’m just preparing for now, is trying to be as good as a dude and develop and get better, so when that happens, it’s just easier."

title: Is Ariana Grande Abandoning Her Singing Career? What She Just Told Her Fans
summary: Ariana Grande has posted a message to fans on Instagram addressing rumors that she may be leaving her singing and music career behind.
story: Ariana Grande has no plans to break free from her singing career.
The “Wicked” actor, 32, who is set to star in more upcoming Hollywood movies, says it’s “silly” for fans to think she would quit music, which she calls her “lifeline,” to focus on other projects.

“Very silly of you all to assume that just because i have my hands full with many things that i plan to abandon singing & music … !!! it is and has always been my lifeline,” Grande captioned a video of her singing July 16 on Instagram.
“There will need to be room made for all of it,” she continued, adding a fairy emoji. “It may not look exactly like it did before but i much prefer how it looks in my head.”
The busy "Side to Side" singer went on to say that she was enjoying herself by expanding creatively.

"I am having fun. i feel grateful and excited and inspired. :) finding a balance, between many projects and endeavors i love, and doing it my own way… so i’m working on a plan to sing for you all next year. even if it’s just for a little. i love you," she concluded.
Grande's fans showed their support in the comments of her post.
"And we love you in all your facets and endeavors," wrote one.
"Seated for all of it," added another, who included a chair emoji.
Grande received her first Academy Award nomination, in the best supporting actress category, for her role as Glinda in "Wicked."
Grande's message to fans comes over a month after news broke that she was joining the star-studded cast of the next "Meet the Parents" movie.
Ben Stiller commented on Grande's casting to NBC News’ Joe Fryer during a joint interview with co-stars Teri Polo and Robert De Niro.
"She's so talented. She's so great with comedy," Stiller said of Grande, adding that her character in the movie will be "really, really funny."
Fryer joked that the movie could turn into a musical thanks to Grande's involvement, prompting Oscar winner De Niro to quip, "The scenes that I have with her will be singing scenes."

Grande will also reunite with her "Wicked" co-star Cynthia Erivo for the sequel, "Wicked: For Good," due in theaters Nov. 21, and she will be lending her voice to an upcoming movie version of the Dr. Seuss kids book “Oh, The Places You’ll Go.”

title: ‘Love Island USA’s’ Amaya Shares Her Go-To Motto — That You Didn’t Hear on the Show
summary: Amaya Espinal charmed her way into viewers’ hearts on “Love Island USA,” all while staying true to herself and being, as she famously put it, her own best friend
story: Amaya Espinal charmed her way into viewers’ hearts on “Love Island USA,” all while staying true to herself and being, as she famously put it, her own best friend.

After Amaya and her partner, Bryan Arenales, were voted the Season 7 winners during the July 13 finale, she said through tears, “This is a message to everyone out there who’s misunderstood. Nobody should ever be tamed.”
Her speech capped off a journey through the “Love Island USA” villa that had its highs and lows.

“Usually back at home, if I feel misunderstood or feel like I don’t want to be around certain people, I could easily block them or walk away,” Amaya tells TODAY.com. “But in the villa, you’re forced to have to stay with them.”

Amaya entered the villa in Episode 4 and off the bat had some tiffs with other islanders. A notable one early on was with Ace Greene, with whom she was coupled and took issue with her casual use of endearments like “babe.”

Meanwhile, viewers grew endeared by Amaya; she shared candid confessionals, embraced her emotions (often by calling herself a “sensitive gangster”), referred to herself in the third person (with the adorable nickname “Amaya Papaya”) and dropped plenty of one-liners that make for equal parts meme and life motivation.
At Casa Amor, she went on to find a connection with someone — but little did she know her true Prince Charming was also right there.
Amaya and Bryan started out as friends in Casa. It wasn’t until Episode 26’s explosive “Stand on Business” challenge that Amaya said she started to catch feelings.

During the challenge, islanders left anonymous notes to each other. One Amaya received said that she cried too much and moved too fast in relationships. As she started to tear up, she was quick to defend herself: “People can express themselves the way that I can express myself, so I’m tired of people viewing that as a negative instead of a power move.”
Ace interrupted, again bringing up her use of “babe.” That’s when Bryan joined the conversation.

“Coming from a Hispanic household, calling someone ‘babe,’ ‘mi amor,’ ‘mi vida,’ that’s just how we talk,” Bryan said in the episode. “You’re telling her to meet you halfway — you got to meet her halfway, too.”

The rest was history. After Amaya “got her smooches” — in which Bryan memorably complimented her muumuu — they coupled up in Episode 30. From there, they spent a night in the private Hideaway, tag-teamed parenting a baby doll, met each other’s families and eventually, on their first and final date in Fiji, went exclusive.
“I feel like I’m a Dominican Cinderella when I’m with you, and I finally found my perfect glass slipper,” she said during the finale.
Below TODAY.com caught up with Amaya and Bryan shortly after they left Fiji to chat about their viral moments, their love story and what’s next.
This interview has been edited for clarity.

Bryan: I think just right from our conversations, they flowed so nice, and just especially on the “Stand on Business” challenge, I’ve instantly seen how misunderstood she was, and I can relate. I felt like I grew up misunderstood in the outside world, and that definitely caught my attention. And once we started talking, I feel like we understood each other right away.
Amaya: I definitely would have to say that my parents played a huge part in that. My father always told me that a strong, confident woman would always intimidate or scare the cowards.

So I knew that it was just more of, like, projection on a lot of people’s part. And instead of just viewing sadness as a weakness, it’s a strength, and we are all blessed to have these emotions. And your girl’s an emotional girl, a sensitive gangster.

Amaya: To be honest, how well she defended herself. That was great to see. But I also saw three people kind of giving her a bad rep for stuff that I see are pearls, because I definitely want a woman that has those things, so I felt like I needed to speak up. They they said something about her calling people “mi amor” and “babe” and stuff like that, and that’s just how Hispanic people talk. I just felt like them saying something, I had to stand up and say something.
Amaya: Oh, my God, I’ve been telling Bryan all day, literally, I am my own best friend. I love to talk to myself, and that’s just me just having that good relationship within yourself.

And I would have to say that the power of the tongue is very powerful. And that’s me doing positive affirmations. So there’s a really huge, positive impact on doing that. You should be your own best friend no matter what.
Amaya: I would definitely say: I’m a butterfly that likes to be in the sky no matter if there’s rain.
Bryan: I love it.
Amaya: Hi, Boston! They’re definitely going to be seeing me, because I have to visit my boo. I’m waiting for that truffle pasta.
Bryan: Right when we got our phones back, we were like, “We’ve got to call family.”
Amaya: It feels very surreal. But to see the love and to see our supporters, our extended family, it’s beautiful. It’s a beautiful thing to just feel validated and reassured.
Bryan: You’ve got to be grateful for it all. Obviously there’s ups and downs, but that’s why we’ve got each other, support each other, get through everything together.

Amaya: To be honest, I let my intrusive thoughts win all the time. Like I really don’t think before I speak. That’s my creativity skill. Like, I’m not the best drawer, but I could definitely just say things.
Bryan: Her creativity is something different.
Amaya: I definitely would say to be your own best friend, and that you should just always talk positivity into your life.
You came into the world by yourself, you’re leaving the world with yourself, so just literally enjoying your own presence.

Amaya: (Laughs) I literally was always on good energy, high energy. I jog back home, so I wasn’t able to jog in the villa besides my zoomies. So at least I was getting my steps in while doing that, right?

Amaya: No. Amaya Papaya, that really started in the villa. Like one person just said it, and it became a waterfall. Everybody started saying it. And I’m like, you know what? I like papayas, anyway, so why not?
I ate a papaya a couple of days ago, and I was like, I usually don’t eat my kids. I swear.
Amaya: I call him Bry Bry.
Bryan: I call her mi amor.
Amaya: Something definitely (by) Bad Bunny.
Bryan: Yeah, it’s a Bad Bunny song, for sure. The culture.
Bryan: I was thinking on how I can end it, and what better way to end it than a quote from the legend, right?
Bryan: We started on camera, and we’ll probably keep showing stuff, but obviously we want to protect us as well, so we’re definitely going to keep some stuff private.

Like she said, we just got our phones back, and we want to check on family and really spend time with each other without a mic or a camera in front of us. We’re getting back to everybody and getting back to all the supporters that we’re super grateful for. Just enjoying our time right now.
“Love Island USA” streams on Peacock, which is part of TODAY’s parent company, NBCUniversal.

title: Chip Gaines Defends New Show ‘Back to the Frontier,’ Featuring a Gay Couple
summary: Chip Gaines appears to have defended his new series, “Back to the Frontier,” for including a same-sex couple after their casting upset fans.
story: Chip Gaines appears to have defended his new series, “Back to the Frontier,” for including a same-sex couple after the casting sparked backlash on social media.

The show features families who quit using technology while trying to live like 19th century pioneers. “Back to the Frontier” includes married couple, Jason Hanna and Joe Riggs, along with their twin 10-year-old sons.
Franklin Graham, the son of evangelical pastor Billy Graham, put the spotlight on the show when he spoke out against the inclusion of the couple.
“I hope this isn’t true, but I read today that Chip and Joanna Gaines are featuring a gay couple in their new series,” he wrote July 12 on X.

“If It is true, it is very disappointing. While we are to love people, we should love them enough to tell them the truth of God’s Word. His Word is absolute truth. God loves us, and His design for marriage is between one man and one woman. Promoting something that God defines as sin is in itself sin," Graham continued.
Chip Gaines did not directly respond to Graham’s post nor did he mention his name or the name of his show when he appeared to discuss the matter in his own X post on July 13.

“Talk, ask qustns, listen.. maybe even learn,” he wrote. “Too much to ask of modern American Christian culture. Judge 1st, understand later/never It’s a sad sunday when “non believers” have never been confronted with hate or vitriol until they are introduced to a modern American Christian.”
“Back to the Frontier” premiered July 10 on the Magnolia Network and HBO Max. Gaines did not respond to TODAY.com’s request for comment on the matter.
He was more direct about addressing the backlash when interacting with users on X.
Gaines replied to one user who said he "can’t" watch the show, and he had an exchange with one person who asked why he was "promoting homosexuality," which Gaines responded to with a Bible verse.
“It’s my favorite verse and it’s in my bio. He clearly went to my bio and tried to use it against me…” the same user later wrote.

“Ha.. I didn’t try to use it against you, I did use it against you.. it’s pretty weird to have a life verse that has specific messaging and instruction that you don’t even come close to applying. But it does seem like you love the attention so enjoy,” Gaines responded.
On Instagram, Hanna and Riggs thanked the Gaineses for including them in "Back to the Frontier."
"We are extremely honored to be one of the three modern day families going #BacktotheFrontier because visibility matters and so important," they said.
Before the backlash over the casting of "Back to the Frontier," the Gaineses have been accused of not supporting members of the LGBTQ+ community.

“The accusations that get thrown at you, like you’re a racist or you don’t like people in the LGBTQ community, that’s the stuff that really eats my lunch — because it’s so far from who we really are. That’s the stuff that keeps me up,” Joanna Gaines told The Hollywood Reporter in 2021.

title: Barack and Michelle Obama Break Silence on Divorce Rumors
summary: The Obamas address divorce rumors in joint interview on her podcast. What they shared about the divorce.
story: The Obamas are laughing off divorce rumors.
Barack Obama and Michelle Obama playfully addressed headlines about their marriage during a July 14 episode of Michelle Obama’s “IMO” podcast.
At the start of the show, Michelle Obama revealed that she had a "very special" guest joining her and her brother, Craig Robinson, who also is a co-host on the podcast.
When they revealed that the guest was none other than Barack Obama, the former U.S president entered the room. He gave Michelle Obama a hug and kiss on the cheek, which made Robinson crack a joke.
"Wait, you guys like each other?” he said.
“That’s the rumor mill,” Michelle Obama replied.
As he was taking his seat, Barack Obama joked, “She took me back. It was touch and go for a while.”

Michelle Obama then warned her hubby not to “start,” but once everyone was settled in their seats, Robinson said, "It’s so nice to have you both in the same room together,” which made Michelle Obama address the divorce rumors.
“I know, because when we aren’t, folks think we’re divorced,” she said.

Robinson said that people approach him on the street to ask about his sister's marriage to the former president. He described an encounter in Wichita, Kansas where a woman asked, "What did he do?" about Barack Obama.
"I said, 'What makes you think he messed up?' Why couldn't it have been her?" he said.
Michelle Obama interjected and said, "Why didn't you just say, 'No one messed up.'"
"I wanted to keep this conversation going so I could tell you about it," Robinson said.
Eventually Robinson told the woman everything was fine between the Obamas. "She was so happy you would've thought I gave her a Christmas gift," he said.
Barack Obama, meanwhile, said these are the headlines he'll "just miss."
"Then someone will mention it to me and I'm like, 'What are you talking about?'" he said.
That's when Michelle Obama stepped in to clear up any confusion about her marriage.

“There hasn’t been one moment in our marriage where I have thought about quitting on my man,” she said. “And we’ve had some really hard times. We’ve had a lot of fun times, a lot of adventures. I’ve become a better person because of the man I’m married to.”
“OK, don’t make me cry now,” Barack Obama interjected. “Not at the beginning of the show.”
Barack and Michelle Obama have been married since 1992 and share two daughters, Malia, 27, and Sasha, 24.
During an April appearance on the “Work in Progress with Sophia Bush” podcast, Michelle Obama said she believes the divorce rumors started once she started to make her own schedule.
Notably, she did not join Barack Obama at the funeral for former President Jimmy Carter in January, nor did she go to President Donald Trump’s inauguration.

“The interesting thing is that, when I say ‘no,’ for the most part people are like, ‘I get it, and I’m OK,’” she said. “That’s the thing that we as women, I think we struggle with disappointing people. So much so that this year people were — they couldn’t even fathom that I was making a choice for myself that they had to assume that my husband and I are divorcing.”

title: Grace Kelly’s Granddaughter Honors Her by Channeling Her Famous ‘Rear Window’ Dress
summary: Grace Kelly's granddaughter Camille Gottlieb paid homage to her late grandma by wearing a dress inspired by the one Kelly wore in "Rear Window."
story: Grace Kelly's iconic sense of style lives on in her granddaughter Camille Gottlieb.
The 27-year-old honored her late grandmother with a special ensemble recently while attending the Monaco Red Cross Gala.
Gottlieb channeled Kelly's stunning black-and-white gown from the 1954 film "Rear Window" in a custom dress from Italian designer Elisabetta Franchi.
On Instagram, Gottlieb shared a series of photos from the night out, including one of herself looking off into the distance as she posed in the gorgeous gown on a balcony.
"A look back at the gala of the Monaco Red Cross. Thank you to Elisabeth Franchi that I could pay homage to my grandmother with this magnificent dress," she captioned the post in French.

Similar to her grandmother's original dress, Gottlieb's gown featured a black off-the-shoulder top and a white skirt. However, she added a modern touch to the look with a plunging neckline, a thigh slit and embellished vine detailing at the waist.
Gottlieb completed the look with a sleek updo and jewelry from Cartier, the brand behind Kelly's iconic engagement ring, per Vogue.

In a separate post, Gottlieb shared a video of herself getting ready for the gala and explained that the new dress was "inspired by" her grandmother's dress but "a little modernized" and "adapted for the gala."
"When I was very little, people told me a lot that I resembled my grandmother. For me, it's one of the best compliments somebody could give me," she said in French.
Gottlieb went on to say it was "an honor to pay homage" to her grandmother.
"I hope she'll be proud of me up there," she said.
Overall, she said she was very pleased with how the outfit turned out and joked, "I hope my feet don't hurt too much."
The influencer didn't have the opportunity to meet her grandmother, who died in 1982, but she certainly inherited her looks.

In 2017, Gottlieb had social media users doing a double take when she shared a photo of herself on Instagram. From her blond hair to her blue eyes and fair skin, Gottlieb closely resembled her grandmother, especially when she sported red lipstick in one of her photos.

title: ‘American Idol’ Runner-Up Auditions for ‘AGT’ Again After Competing in Season 1: How It Went
summary: Jessica Sanchez was on Season 1 of "AGT" and Season 11 of "American Idol." She auditioned with "Beautiful Things" for Season 20 of "AGT" and got a Golden Buzzer.
story: Jessica Sanchez hasn't given up on music.
After being eliminated from “America’s Got Talent” 20 years ago, she made her triumphant return on Season 20 of the program when she auditioned again and sang “Beautiful Things” by Benson Boone.

“I’ve been singing since I was a little girl, but me trying out for ‘America’s Got Talent,’ that was a whole different world — just the excitement and the thrill of it all,” she said. “I did want this so bad. I made it to the semifinals. I did get eliminated. It was devastating, but it really did help me realize I want to sing. ‘AGT’ was the beginning of that fire sparked inside of me.”

Sanchez, 29, then told judges Simon Cowell, Sofia Vergara, Howie Mandel and Mel B what she's been up to since she originally competed on the program. She explained she's married now and is also pregnant with her first child.
She also said she's happy to be back singing because there was a time when she lost her love for music. Sanchez even competed on Season 11 of "American Idol."

"Throughout the years, I kind of fell out of love of music because I was really young and I was so swayed by what everybody wanted me to be, who they wanted me to be, and so maybe it took me 20 years, but I know exactly who I am. I know exactly what I want. I'm excited to be back," she said.
After the judges wished her well, Sanchez brought down the house when she sang Boone's 2024 hit song and hit all the high notes along the way.

When she was done, she received a standing ovation from the   audience. At that point, it was clear she was moving onto the next round, and all the judges agreed. Vergara even pressed the Golden Buzzer for the tearful singer, which guarantees a contestant an automatic spot in the live shows.
"You deserve it," she said while giving Sanchez a hug onstage.
If Sanchez's stint on "America's Got Talent" is anything like her time on "American Idol," then she's sure to go far on the reality TV show. Scroll below to learn how she did on "American Idol."
Jessica Sanchez Competed on 'American Idol' in Season 11
In 2012, Sanchez competed on Season 11 of "American Idol."

She made it all the way to the Top 7 until she was in danger of being eliminated after receiving the least amount of America's votes. However, the judges ended up using their one save on her to keep her in the competition, which ended up propelling her to advance to the finale.
She lost to fellow contestant Phillip Phillips and was the season's runner-up.

title: 'American Idol' Music Supervisor and Her Husband Found Dead in Their Los Angeles Home
summary: A man was arrested Tuesday in the fatal shootings of an “American Idol” music supervisor and her husband, a day after the couple was found dead in their Los Angeles home, police and a representative of the show said
story: A man was arrested Tuesday in the fatal shootings of an “American Idol” music supervisor and her husband, a day after the couple was found dead in their Los Angeles home, police and a representative of the show said.

Robin Kaye and Thomas Deluca, both 70, were found about 2:30 p.m. Monday after officers were called to their Encino home for a welfare check and discovered blood at the front door, the Los Angeles Police Department said.
A suspect, Raymond Boodarian, 22, also of Encino, was identified and arrested after homicide detectives worked through the night, the police department said.
Charges were not announced in a news release Tuesday evening, but police alleged that he is responsible for the double homicide.
Kaye was a music supervisor for “American Idol,” according to celebrity website TMZ, which first reported the killings Tuesday.
“We are devastated to hear of Robin and her dear husband, Tom’s, passing,” a spokesperson for “American Idol” said.

“Robin has been a cornerstone of the Idol family since 2009 and was truly loved and respected by all who came in contact with her,” the spokesperson said. “Robin will remain in our hearts forever and we share our deepest sympathy with her family and friends during this difficult time.”

The LAPD said that officers were called to the home in Encino, a neighborhood in the San Fernando Valley area of Los Angeles, at 4 p.m. Thursday on a report of a burglar but officers saw no sign of any burglary.
Investigators now believe that the burglar entered the home on that date through an unlocked door and the couple came home while the suspect was still there, the police department said.
Investigators believe there was a confrontation and the suspect shot both victims multiple times and then fled on foot, the LAPD said.
The investigation is ongoing, police said Tuesday.
The person who called Monday about a welfare check at the home did so after they had not heard from the resident for several days, police said.
A phone number for relatives of Boodarian could not be immediately found in online public records. It was not clear if he had an attorney.

title: Jared Goff Is a Girl Dad! NFL Star and Wife Christen Harper Welcome First Baby
summary: NFL quarterback Jared Goff and wife Christen Harper have welcomed their first child, a daughter named Romy Isabelle. The couple shared photos and revealed the baby’s name.
story: NFL star Jared Goff and his wife, Christen Harper Goff, are first-time parents!
On July 15, the couple announced that they welcomed their first child together, a baby girl.

The pair shared the news by uploading a joint Instagram post filled with adorable black-and-white photos of their newborn. The first photo showed their daughter lying on her back while holding her mom’s finger with her tiny hand.
In another snap, Goff, 30, sweetly cradled his daughter and gazed into her eyes. The couple bonded with their baby girl in a third picture as the Detroit Lions quarterback sported a “Girl Dad” cap.
They revealed their daughter's name in the caption, simply writing, “Romy Isabelle Goff” and including a love letter emoji.

Harper Goff, 32, shared the photo of her husband holding Romy on her Instagram story as well, writing, “Heart is bursting into a million pieces!!!!” She added the Coldplay song “Green Eyes” to the post.
She also uploaded the same close-up of their daughter from the slideshow to her next story and wrote “ROMY!” with a white heart, cloud and wing emoji.
Fans and celebrity friends celebrated Romy’s arrival in the comments beneath the joint post.
Olivia Culpo, who recently welcomed her first child with husband and NFL running back Christian McCaffrey, cheered, “Congratulations!!!”
Taylor Lautner wrote, “Congratulations you two (three).”
Michael Phelps said, “Congrats!!!”
Goff and Harper Goff, a model and actor, have been married since 2024. They met on the celebrity dating app Raya, she revealed in a 2022 Sports Illustrated video.

“I was truly not looking for anything at the time,” Harper Goff said. “I had just gotten out of a long relationship and I was trying to stay single for a year. Then I met him and the rest is history.”
She also shared on Season 2 of the Netflix series “Quarterback” that they met in 2018 before the football season began.
“Jared was playing for the Rams. We just hit it off right away. They won a million games,” she said on the show, adding: “I was a good luck charm, obviously.”
When the pair revealed during a February interview with People that they had a baby on the way, Goff said, “I can’t wait to watch her be a mom.”

title: Olivia Culpo Sparks Debate With Hospital Bag Picks — But Fans Say She’s Got It Right
summary: Olivia Culpo’s TikTok showing her hospital bag for labor has gone viral. From cozy comfort items to stylish outfits and surprising extras like flameless candles, see what the model packed and why it’s sparking debate.
story: Packing for labor is rarely glamorous — unless you’re Olivia Culpo. The model and influencer’s hospital bag video is going viral for being both luxe and (possibly) practical.

Culpo, 33, who announced the birth of her daughter with NFL player Christian McCaffrey earlier this week, has sparked conversation with a TikTok showing exactly what she packed for the hospital. Since being posted on July 10, the video has received more than 1.9 million views and nearly 4,000 comments.

“I worked really hard on this, and I know how overwhelming the whole process is,” Culpo says at the start of the clip. “I committed a while ago to making a video. I’ve watched so many of these and they’re really interesting.”
It quickly becomes clear Culpo isn’t a throw-it-in-a-duffel-and-go kind of packer.

“Everything in this first suitcase is, like, my comfort stuff,” she explains. “Two fluffy comforters, twin size for Christian and I ... Two sleep masks. I have one mini fan. I actually got another one.”

She continues, sharing that she also intends to pack items for aromatherapy, a plushy robe from Chasa and a photo of her dog. Culpo topped off her list of comfortable items with what she describes as the "most ridiculous" thing she's packed: a set of flameless flickering candles.

When it comes to outfits, Culpo has those covered, too — from a matching lounge robe set and “all of my favorite pajama sets” to an “all-cashmere black outfit,” nursing bras, and products for foot swelling.
Culpo ends the video with a dose of self-awareness: “I hope you guys find it useful, but if you didn’t find any of this helpful and you think I’m ridiculous... then I slightly agree with you.”
While some viewers were surprised by the sheer volume of what she packed, others defended her approach.
"As a labor nurse...literally bring whatever you want," wrote one viewer. "Comfort is important, especially if you have a C-section and a longer hospital stay."

When one user questioned Culpo's decision to include so many white bedding a clothing items, she replied, “If you’re bleeding enough after a C-section to soak THROUGH your pads/diaper/bandages and onto your bedding, that’s a serious medical issue, not a packing fail,” she wrote.
“Also… the hospital sheets are already white. Are you going to ask them if they have other colors for you lol.”
In large part, her inclusion of the candles had people debating.
"The flickering candles made me literally LOL," one commented, while another said, "Everyone hating on the flickering candles hasn't given birth LOL having mine made my room so much more peaceful!"

"I am SOOOOOO happy I had these," Culpo replied. "They come with a remote control.. I had a c section so I couldn’t get up to turn on or off the lights (which are horrible and fluorescent anyway) .. I wanted to be able to see the baby at night etc. No one will ever convince me these were a bad idea I’m sorry."
In the end, most users just wanted to know what actually worked for the model at the end of the day.
“Omg are you kidding,” one person commented. “That is so much — you have to do another video and tell us what you actually used lol.

title: Emmy Nominations 2025: See the Full List of Nominees
summary: The 2025 Emmy Awards nominations are here. See the full list of nominees announced on July 15 ahead of the ceremony this fall.
story: The 2025 Emmy award nominations are here.
The Television Academy revealed the full list of nominations for the 77th Emmy Awards on July 15, with shows like "The Penguin," "Severance" and "The Last of Us" receiving multiple nominations.

The nominees in two categories, outstanding reality competition program and outstanding talk series, were announced early Tuesday morning, and the rest of the nominees were revealed via livestream at 11:30 a.m. ET, with actors Harvey Guillén and Brenda Song presenting the categories alongside Television Academy chair Cris Abrego.
The 77th Emmy Awards will be held in Los Angeles on Sept. 14 at 8 p.m. ET and will be hosted by comedian Nate Bargatze. The show will air live on CBS and will be available to stream on Paramount+.

To be eligible for this years’ awards, TV series had to premiere between June 2024 and May 2025. At last year’s award ceremony, shows like “Hacks” and “Shōgun” won big, with “Shōgun” winning a record 18 Emmys for its first season.

title: Royal Chef Details Princess Diana's Favorite Breakfast
summary: Here is Princess Diana's overnight oats recipe, according to former royal chef Darren McGrady
story: Princess Diana was known for her impeccable taste — and that extended to her breakfast choices, too. Now, her former chef is sharing the morning meal that suited her palate and proves once again she was ahead of the curve: overnight oats.

In a June 27 YouTube video, former royal chef Darren McGrady, who cooked for the late Princess Diana at Kensington Palace, revealed that the royal preferred overnight oats, a dish she ate almost every day.
McGrady’s video, titled “Princess Diana’s Overnight Oats,” shows him in a professional kitchen preparing the dish as he once did for the princess.
In the video, McGrady explains how the dish reflected the royal’s interest in health and wellness.
"She was working out at the gym three days a week, and just looking the best she ever did," he explained, noting that she had overnight oats almost 20 years before it became a social media craze.
According to McGrady, Diana came to learn about the dish while visiting a Swiss health clinic.
“There she had these overnight oats — they were actually called Birchermüesli — and they were invented by a Swiss nutritionist,” he explains.
"She thought they were really, really good, and all the ingredients were super healthy. She stole the recipe, came back and said, 'Dan, I want these for breakfast every day.'"
Below is the exact overnight oats recipe McGrady says he prepared for Princess Diana.
Princess Diana’s Overnight Oats Recipe
As prepared by royal chef Darren McGrady
Rolled oatsOrange juiceGreek yogurtLemon juiceHoneycrisp apple, grated with the skin on Blueberries, large-sizedWalnuts
Rolled oats
Orange juice
Greek yogurt
Lemon juice
Honeycrisp apple, grated with the skin on
Blueberries, large-sized
Walnuts
Add rolled oats to a bowl.
Pour orange juice into the bowl until oats are covered.
Cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate overnight.
Remove the oats from the refrigerator.
Add spoonfuls of Greek yogurt to the bowl and gently fold in.
Drizzle raw honey over the mixture to taste.
Add a splash of lemon juice.
Grate the apple over the oats and stir.
Add blueberries and walnuts, fold in.
Garnish with blueberries, walnuts and serve.

title: Martin Scorsese’s Daughter Francesca Shares His Sweet Reaction to 1st Acting Emmy Nod
summary: Martin Scorsese received his first-ever Emmy nomination for acting in Apple TV+’s The Studio. His daughter Francesca Scorsese shared a photo of his reaction on Instagram.
story: Film lovers know Martin Scorsese is one of the industry's most seasoned and respected directors, but even he seems to have become emotional when he received his first Emmy nomination for acting on July 15.
The 82-year-old filmmaker was nominated in the outstanding guest actor in a comedy series category for his performance in the Apple TV+ comedy "The Studio."
Martin Scorsese's youngest daughter, Francesca Scorsese, 25, shared a photo in her Instagram story that showed her father appearing emotional about the milestone.
The image, a screenshot the younger Scorsese grabbed from a FaceTime call with her father, showed the "Goodfellas" director covering his eyes with his hands.
In the upper corner, his proud daughter could be seen smiling over her father's unexpected honor.

Martin Scorsese, who played a wackier version of himself in the first episode of "The Studio," competes in the category against Jon Bernthal for a guest appearance on "The Bear," and four other actors who also made guest appearances on "The Studio:" Bryan Cranston, Dave Franco, Anthony Mackie and former "Happy Days" star Ron Howard, who, like Martin Scorsese, has been known primarily as a director for decades.
Francesca Scorsese shared an image of all six contenders and tagged her father. "Our little actor," she wrote lovingly, adding a hands-making-a-heart emoji.
Martin Scorsese has been nominated for a handful of Emmys in the past, but never before for acting.

He won his first Emmy in 2011 for directing an episode of the drama series "Boardwalk Empire." The following year, he picked up two more Emmys for directing and producing the documentary "George Harrison: Living in the Material World."
Francesca Scorsese's sweet tributes are hardly the first time she's featured her dad in her social media posts.
In October 2023, she challenged her father to guess the meaning of contemporary slang words in a hilarious TikTok video she titled "Dad Guesses Slang."

In March 2024, she shared two videos in her Instagram story that showed her father gleefully reacting to Ryan Gosling’s live performance of his "Barbie" anthem “I’m Just Ken” at the 2025 Academy Awards.
In the videos, Martin Scorsese, who was nominated that year for his thriller “Killers of the Flower Moon,” could be seen laughing and clapping during Gosling's over-the-top performance.
“This is the best video ever. @martinscorsese_,” the doting daughter captioned the  fun clip.
Martin Scorsese shares Francesca Scorsese with his wife, Helen Morris.

The "Taxi Driver" director, who's been married five times, is also dad to two older daughters: Cathy Scorsese, 59, whom he shares with his first wife, Laraine Brennan; and Domenica Cameron-Scorsese, 48, whom he shares with his second wife Julia Cameron.

title: ‘Dying Is the Opposite of Leaving’: Andrea Gibson Reads Poem to Wife in Final TV Interview
summary: In their final interview before dying at 49, Andrea Gibson reads a tender poem for their wife that’s now touching hearts across the internet.
story: A recording of Andrea Gibson reading “Love Letter From The Afterlife” — a tender poem written for their wife, Megan Falley — is going viral following their death this week at the age of 49.

The stirring delivery took place during the poet laureate’s final televised interview, recorded in April 2025 for NBC’s “It’s OK to Ask Questions.” The segment aired in June, just one month before Gibson’s death on July 14.
In the video, Gibson shares the intention behind crafting the emotional yet hopeful piece they wrote for Falley.

"When I wrote this, I was writing it for Meg, but I shared it online, and I shared it so that people who had lost someone might feel more connected to the person they had lost," they explain ahead of the reading.
"Still, I don't think I ever told anybody that I had written it from my own perspective, because I didn't want to upset anyone."
Gibson then reads the poem — one that reflects their awareness that Falley would be the one left to grieve after they die.

"My love, I was so wrong. Dying is the opposite of leaving. When I left my body, I did not go away," Gibson's poem begins. "That portal of light was not a portal to elsewhere, but a portal to here. I am more here than I ever was before. I am more with you than I ever could have imagined. So close you look past me when wondering where I am."
Filmed outdoors, the clip shows Gibson and Falley sitting in the grass as the poet reads.
"Why did no one tell us that to die is to be reincarnated in those we love while they are still alive? Ask me the altitude of heaven, and I will answer, 'How tall are you?'"

Views of Gibson's reading have increased in the aftermath of their death, as longtime followers of their work and those newly discovering it share it across platforms. The clip from the interview has already garnered over 22,000 views on YouTube since it was posted July 14.

Along with thoughts of awe at Gibson's ability to write a poem about love that endures as they faced their own mortality, many expressed gratitude to the poet for simply crafting such vulnerable words

"I see the news that someone I never met in person has died, and it knocks the breath out of me and leaves me weeping," a commenter on YouTube replied to a post of the reading. "Your light, your depth, your words have touched my soul. Your poetry has been the portal to a connection to you that makes our never having met in person meaningless. I love you, Andrea. Thank you for everything."
"Weeping," another read. "I’m weeping for love, for their love, for the beauty and truth that transcends death."

"Andrea Andrea Andrea forever with us, forever inspiring us," added one more. "I lost my grandmother this spring, and I came to this conclusion too from the help of art and stories like this one. Sending so much love to Andrea’s loved ones that will surely be grieving for quite some time. But having this love letter is more than enough to remember the truth. Those who die never leave us."
Gibson's poem "Love Letter From The Afterlife" was originally published on their Substack on Dec. 21, 2023.

title: Savannah Chrisley Opens Up for the 1st Time About Getting Liposuction
summary: Savannah Chrisley is opening up for the first time about her decision to have liposuction surgery.
story: Savannah Chrisley is opening up for the first time about her decision to have liposuction surgery.
The 27-year-old spoke about her experience with the cosmetic procedure and her health issues during the July 15 episode of her “Unlocked with Savannah Chrisley” podcast.
For the episode, Chrisley was joined by her friend and plastic surgeon, Dr. Charlie Galanis, who performed the medical procedure.

“I’ll just be honest here, because that’s what my life is these days. I’m just honest about everything. The way that Charlie and I met was through another plastic surgeon, because I was wanting to get some work done. You did my lipo,” she explained at the beginning of the podcast while introducing Galanis.
Chrisley did not specify when the procedure had taken place, but said it was "a while ago."
She said she decided to have the surgery, which “removes unwanted fat deposits” from the body according to Cleveland Clinic, after gaining weight and struggling with her health.

The reality television star continued, “I was going through all kinds of s— with my endometriosis, and I had taken this medication, and I gained 40 pounds, literally, in like three months. It was crazy.”
She previously shared in 2020 that she underwent her third surgery to treat her endometriosis diagnosis.

“I was diagnosed with Endometriosis when I was 18 and it’s been quite the struggle. The pain at times is unbearable and the toll it takes on my emotional/psychological health is pretty rough at times,” she wrote at the time on Instagram.

Endometriosis refers to tissue that is similar to the lining of the uterus growing in other areas of the body. It can lead to pelvic pain, heavy periods and possible fertility issues, according to Cleveland Clinic.
Following her weight gain, Chrisley had a campaign shoot scheduled and wasn’t satisfied with her physical appearance, she said on her podcast.
“I hated how I looked, and I called you. It happened fast,” she told Galanis.
She had a virtual consultation with Galanis and agreed to fly to his practice in Beverly Hills, California, with her mom, Julie Chrisley, to undergo the surgery a week later.
“For me, it was just, I felt like s---. I didn’t like how I looked. Like, if you don’t like how you look, it doesn’t just take the toll on you physically, but emotionally and mentally,” she shared.

Galanis chimed in to agree and said that for him the plastic surgery business is about how his patients feel when the procedure is completed. He also said that Chrisley initially wanted to “a la carte” other cosmetic procedures before he convinced her otherwise.
Chrisley went on to gush about the results from her liposuction and how they affected her body image in just six weeks.
“When you can look in the mirror and see a difference, it, for me, (made) me want to live a healthier life,” she said. “When I saw the results, I was like, ‘Oh my gosh, I want to keep this up!’”
Galanis recalled Chrisley sending him pictures of her progress. He said that she looked great before and that the surgery added “some refinements.”
In addition to liposuction, Chrisley also mentioned that she takes GLP-1 supplements.

title: See the HBO 'Harry Potter' Reboot Actors Side by Side with the Original's Stars
summary: See the cast of the HBO Harry Potter series side by side with the original movie stars.
story: HBO's upcoming "Harry Potter" TV show is starting to feel a lot more real now that filming has started.
On July 14, the network shared a photo of Dominic McLaughlin in character as Harry Potter to mark the first day of filming in London. A snap of Nick Frost as Rubeus Hagrid followed on July 15.
The network has released names of the cast in batches over the course of the year. This is the first time, however, we're seeing the actors in their Hogwarts garb.
Below, see the cast of "Harry Potter" side-by-side with the actors from the original movie series, which started in 2001 and concluded in 2011.
Harry Potter (Dominic McLaughlin and Daniel Radcliffe)
On July 14, the network released a photo of Dominic McLaughlin in costume as Harry Potter.
In the photo, a smiling McLaughlin holds up a clapperboard that commemorated a major moment for the TV series: The first take of the first scene of the first episode.
The young actor bears a striking resemblance to Daniel Radcliffe, who originated the role of the Boy Who Lived when “Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone” was first released in 2001.

The wardrobe will be familiar to fans of the franchise. McLaughlin wears a Hogwarts robe and his signature round glasses. A lightning bolt-shaped forehead scar and tousled black hair finish off the look.
Rubeus Hagrid (Nick Frost and Robbie Coltrane)

A day later, on July 15, the network released a photo of Nick Frost as Rubeus Hagrid, Hogwarts' lovable gamekeeper and groundskeeper who takes Harry under his wing when he first joins the school of witchcraft and wizardry.
Robbie Coltrane, who died in 2022, originated the role.
In the picture, Frost sports Hagrid's signature long brown locks, luscious beard and majestic mustache. He also wears a sporty green coat that looks just like something the gentle giant would rock.
Who else is in the 'Harry Potter' TV series?
The network has also announced the casting of the following roles:
